newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's UES rises on quiet shares market. [CORRECTED 15:55 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Russia's UES rises on quiet shares market. [CORRECTED 15:55 GMT]

text.p: Leading Russian shares firmed in late afternoon trade on Friday on news of a management shakeup at national electricity utility UES, traders said.
But they did not see significant market movement by closing.

"It's been pretty quiet all day, until a few hours ago," said Renaissance Capital trader Dmitry Kryukov. News earlier in the afternoon that UES vice-president Boris Brevnov would become chief executive had pushed UES prices higher.
Market leader UES jumped to $0.3205 at 5.40 p.m. (1340 GMT) from $0.3180 on Thursday.
Brevnov replaces Anatoly Dyakov as UES president. Dyakov (corrects from Brevnov) will retain his position as UES chairman.

CentreInvest Securities trader Alexander Pankov said potential sellers and buyers were largely balanced on the market and predicted the Russian Trading System 22-share index would be little changed by the end of trade.
It had edged down to 356.41 at 4 p.m. (1200 GMT) from Thursday's close of 359.04.
Natural gas group Gazprom showed the market's highest turnover, about $31 million to UES's $14 million. Gazprom firmed to $0.656 from $0.628 on Thursday.
Kryukov said some shareholders were nervous ahead of next month's annual meeting. He said a number of big blockholders were being traded.
Gazprom and UES are at the heart of a government campaign to revamp the country's natural monopolies, huge industries with no competition.
